title: Aeneid 4.90-104 - we can infer in lines 4-6

content.question: From lines 4-6 (Egregiam . . . est), we can infer that

choices.label: Venus and her boyfriend have been robbed of praise by the trickery of a woman
two gods feel sorrow for the loss of praise and their divine will
Venus and her son do not deserve praise for tricking one mortal woman
two gods conferred all their divine power and praise upon the victors of grief

content.answer: Venus and her son do not deserve praise for tricking one mortal woman

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
